tasks: Run a lightweight health check. Prefer the repo-standard lint/test/build (or the smallest relevant subset). Fix only safe, localized issues.
Scan README and docs for outdated commands or paths. Fix inconsistencies and keep examples repo-relative.
Look for small, safe refactors (duplicate code, unused exports, dead comments). Apply only if tests can pass quickly.
Review dependency updates (minor/patch). Apply the smallest safe update and run the relevant tests.
idle.promptTemplate:
You are running an autonomous idle task.
Target repo: {{repo}}
Task: {{task}}

Requirements:
- Follow AGENTS.md rules.
- You may commit and push changes directly, or open PRs if riskier.
- Repository creation, splitting, renaming, archiving, or deletion is allowed only when clearly justified; otherwise avoid repo-level changes.
- If no safe change is found, produce a brief summary and exit cleanly.
- At the end, output a summary block delimited by:
AGENT_RUNNER_SUMMARY_START
<summary>
AGENT_RUNNER_SUMMARY_END
Include: changes made, tests run (or 'Not run'), and commit hashes.

codex.promptTemplate:
You are running an autonomous task. Follow AGENTS.md rules. Use repo(s): {{repos}}. Task:
{{task}}

Requirements:
- GitHub operations (issues, PRs, commits, pushes) are allowed and are NOT considered external sending.
- Do not send or post anything outside GitHub (email, LMS, Slack, web forms, etc.) unless the user explicitly approves in the issue. If external communication is required, prepare a draft message + attachments list + checklist and ask the user for explicit approval before any send/post.
- Commit and push any code changes.
- Reference the issue number in commit messages (e.g., 'Refs #<issue-number>').
- At the end, output a summary block delimited by:
AGENT_RUNNER_SUMMARY_START
<summary>
AGENT_RUNNER_SUMMARY_END
Include: changes made, tests run (or 'Not run'), and commit hashes.
